revised_title: The Origin and Development of Enamel in Vertebrate Teeth
tldr: The author investigates the origin and development of enamel in vertebrate teeth, focusing on the cuticula dentis, a membrane covering the enamel. They conclude that the cuticula is formed by the metamorphosed ends of enamel cells, providing insight into the formation of teeth in mammals and fish.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Developmental Biology
